election_record.label: Vermont 1805 Governor

overview.note: "His Excellency Isaac Tichenor, Esq. is elected Governor." Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805. p.6

There seems to have been considerable confusion over the total results. Of the officially recorded votes, there were 8683 for Isaac Tichenor, 5054 for Jonathan Robinson, and 524 scattering. In addition, the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT) and The Post-Boy, and Vermont and New-Hampshire Federal Courier (Windsor, VT) reported 485 rejected votes for Tichenor, 204 rejected votes for Robinson and 35 rejected scattering votes. Yet, town totals for individual rejected towns add up to at least 546 rejected votes for Tichenor, 270 rejected votes for Robinson, and 14 rejected scattering votes. This gives Tichenor 9209 total votes and Robinson 5258 votes, and, with individual votes for scattering candidates listed from various towns, 327 unaccounted for scattering votes.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), November 2; the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), October 30; and The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), October 15, report 725 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 465 for Jonathan Robinson in Addison County.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The votes from Addison were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates accompanying said votes," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 6.

sub_unit.name: Lincoln
sub_unit.note: The votes from Lincoln were rejected, "there being no date to certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Lincoln.

sub_unit.name: Middlebury
sub_unit.note: The votes from Middlebury were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Shoreham
sub_unit.note: The votes from Shoreham were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Starksborough
sub_unit.note: The votes from Starksborough were rejected because"the certificate was not signed by the presiding officer," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Starksborough.

sub_unit.name: Vergennes
sub_unit.note: The votes from Vergennes were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: The votes from Warren were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Landgrove
sub_unit.note: The votes from Landgrove were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Landgrove.

sub_unit.name: Chittenden
sub_unit.note: The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), November 2, the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), October 30, and The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), October 15, report 822 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 435 for Jonathan Robinson in Chittenden County.

sub_unit.name: Middlesex
sub_unit.note: The votes from Middlesex were rejected, "not being certified by the town clerk," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Middlesex.

sub_unit.name: Shelburne
sub_unit.note: The votes from Shelburne were rejected, "there being no certificate of meeting, or date," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7.

sub_unit.name: Stowe
sub_unit.note: The votes from Stowe were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805.

sub_unit.name: Brunswick
sub_unit.note: The votes from Brunswick were rejected, "the certificate not certified by the Town Clerk," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Brunswick.

sub_unit.name: Canaan
sub_unit.note: The votes from Canaan were rejected, "the certificate not certified by the Town Clerk," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Canaan.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), November 2 reports 780 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 188 for Jonathan Robinson in Franklin County.

The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), October 15; The Post-Boy, and Vermont and New-Hampshire Federal Courier (Windsor, VT), October 29; and the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), October 30, report 780 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 182 votes for Jonathan Robinson in Franklin County.

sub_unit.name: Fletcher
sub_unit.note: The votes from Fletcher were rejected, "the certificates not being certified by the town clerk," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Fletcher.

sub_unit.name: Huntsburgh
sub_unit.note: The votes from Huntsburgh were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: Isaac Tichenor received all of the votes in this town, however, neither the number of votes nor the number of freemen were given.

sub_unit.name: Sheldon
sub_unit.note: The votes from Sheldon were rejected, "there being no certificates of the meeting, or date," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Sheldon.

sub_unit.name: Vineyard
sub_unit.note: The votes from Vineyard were rejected, "there being no certificates of the meeting, or date," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), October 15, The Post-Boy, and Vermont and New-Hampshire Federal Courier (Windsor, VT), October 29, and the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), October 30, and the Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), November 2, report 824 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 407 for Jonathan Robinson in Orange County.

sub_unit.name: Braintree
sub_unit.note: William Hunter received 1 vote as William Hunt.

sub_unit.name: Chelsea
sub_unit.note: The votes from Chelsea were rejected, "there being no certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7.

sub_unit.name: Roxbury
sub_unit.note: The votes from Roxbury were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates." Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7.

sub_unit.name: Thetford
sub_unit.note: The votes from Thetford were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 6. There are not records of the votes cast in Thetford.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: The votes from Washington were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7.

sub_unit.name: Coventry
sub_unit.note: The votes from Coventry were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Coventry.

sub_unit.name: Eden
sub_unit.note: The votes from Eden were rejected. The Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7 notes that this was because "in the certificates, the freemans meeting is certified to be holden on the fourth day of September." There are not records of the votes cast in Eden.

sub_unit.name: Troy
sub_unit.note: The votes from Westmore were rejected, "the certificates not signed by the presiding officer" according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Troy.

sub_unit.name: Westmore
sub_unit.note: The votes from Westmore were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Westmore.

sub_unit.name: Wolcott
sub_unit.note: The votes from Wolcott were rejected, "there being no date to the certificates," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805, 7. There are not records of the votes cast in Wolcott.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), The Post-Boy, and Vermont and New-Hampshire Federal Courier (Windsor, VT), October 30, and the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), October 30, all list 22 votes, and The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT) lists 29 votes, for candidates other than Isaac Tichenor and Jonathan Robinson, but the town totals add up to 25 votes in Windham County.

sub_unit.name: Halifax
sub_unit.note: The Brattleborough Reporter, September 14, reports 72 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 33 for Jonathan Robinson in Halifax.

sub_unit.name: Wardsboro
sub_unit.note: The Brattleboro Reporter, Septemer 14, reports 106 votes for Isaac Tichenor in Wardsboro.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Rutland Herald (Rutland, VT), November 2, the Middlebury Mercury (Middlebury, VT), October 30; The Post-Boy, and Vermont and New-Hampshire Federal Courier (Windsor, VT), October 29, and the The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT), October 15, report 979 votes for Isaac Tichenor and 1131 for Jonathan Robinson in Windsor County.

sub_unit.name: Stockbridge
sub_unit.note: The votes from Stockbridge were rejected, because "votes for Treasurer, in the certificate were certified for Governor," according to the Journals of the General Assembly of the State of Vermont, 1805. It is unclear whether the votes recorded here were intended for governor, or if they are the treasurer votes misattributed to the gubernatorial election.

election_record.reference: Journal of the Vermont General Assembly, 1805. 6-8.
The Green Mountain Patriot (Peacham, VT). October 15, 1805.
The Post-Boy, and Vermont and New-Hampshire Federal Courier (Windsor, VT). October 29, 1805.
Fairbanks, Edward Taylor. The Town of St. Johnsbury VT: a review of one hundred and twenty-five years to the anniversary pageant 1912. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Cowles Press, 1914.
